what.question: What is a DDS file?
what.answer: DDS (DirectDraw Surface) is a file format used primarily in video games and 3D applications for storing compressed texture files. It was developed by Microsoft for use with DirectX.

why.question: Why convert DDS to PNG?
why.answer: PNG files are more widely supported and can be opened by most image viewers and editors. Converting DDS to PNG makes your textures more accessible for general use.

limits.question: Are there any file size limits?
limits.answer: Yes, we currently support DDS files up to 50MB in size. For larger files, please contact us for custom solutions.

security.question: Is my data secure?
security.answer: Yes, all file processing is done locally in your browser. Your files are never stored on our servers and are automatically deleted after conversion.

formats.question: What DDS formats are supported?
formats.answer: We support most common DDS formats including DXT1, DXT3, DXT5, BC7, and uncompressed formats. If you have a specific format need, please contact us.
